name: The Montpellier Chapter Hotel

reviews.text: Well refurbished hotel in a great location. Feature rooms are amazing, some standard rooms can only be described as cupboards - you may not be able to stand up in these showers (eave walled) nor open the wardrobe doors (it hits the bed before it opens) and I would suggest that these rooms are terribly overpriced.
reviews.title: Lottery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is hit and miss. Staff turnover is high and training appears to be low. All staff are well-meaning but not necessarily competent.
reviews.title: All In The Detail

reviews.text: Beds and linens are very comfortable and there is no extra service charge for room service. The minibar is free and the food is excellent, although the breakfast is very rich (most items seem to include some sort of cream!).
reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room temperatures are difficult to control (thermostats don't always work) and lighting for doing make-up in the mirror is terrible!
reviews.title: A great weekend

reviews.text: I've stayed here sporadically on business for the past year, some visits have been perfect, others have been terrible. Cross your fingers and you will have a great stay!
reviews.title: Luxury break

reviews.text: I was surprised by a weekend away for my hen do in The Montpellier Hotel and what a nice surprise it was. The decor is Modern clean with some interesting art work. The breakfasts are worth visiting the hotel all on their own. The service was prompt, friendly and helpful. The rooms where spacious, modern, cleaned to perfection with an amazing shower. In short my bridesmaid picked the perfect hotel I like with a modern clean and up market feel. Also to note they were very accommodating to any of our requests and frankly couldn’t do enough for us. It is also somewhere I look forward to going back to on a couples weekend which would be equally as appropriate. I really don’t have a bad word to say about the Montpellier.
reviews.title: Book now!

reviews.text: Great location in town. Super room with modern design. Decent coffee machine in room - how refreshing. Staff were charming throughout our stay. Breakfast was great too. Paperless check-in/out and itouch in room (rather than ubiquitous folder of hotel info) were clever and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent contemporary design in a beautiful old building

reviews.text: Very pretty hotel with smart facilities. However, it was let down by poor management. My room service bill was not put my account but someone else's bill was. The card reader did not work when checking out and there was a large queue of us. Finally, they have speakers in the ceiling of the lounge playing music, which can clearly be heard in room 116. Also some drunk guests were singing loudly at 1:30am and no one shut them up. All of the things I have described could be fixed easily but they weren't. I think an area manager needs to go in an ask questions.
reviews.title: Lovely facilities but chaotic management

reviews.text: The hotel is within easy walking distance to shops, restaurants, etc. I was pleasantly surprised by the room which was sleek and modern. All the details about the hotel were loaded onto a Ipod in the room. If you aren't familiar with Apple products, this may not be the best choice for you - even the registration/check out process is done by the staff who carry laptops with them. The full english breakfast included with my room was wonderful. I would recommend this hotel for those looking for first class comfort and a modern, high tech style.
reviews.title: High tech rooms in lovely old mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, staff helpful and friendly. Room good with nice balcony overlooking Cheltenham rooftops to the Cotswold hills. Food lovely with quirky wine list on i-pad. Beware of bar prices single gin & tonic £8, this was the only minus.
reviews.title: Excellent - But!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First big tick in box - convenient underground car park closely followed by helpful, polite staff at check in. The room was great - modern, minimal, a bit cool and funky with white and warm wood decs - spacious with big comfy bed, big bath in middle of room (which we loved) and good rainfall shower and best of all - at last somebody has updated the whole minibar and tea/coffee facilities thing! (Other hotels please take note!) Complimentary fresh milk, beers, waters and chocolate - just what you need - and a proper size kettle and big mugs to make the drinks in - YES!
reviews.title: Ticked all the right boxes for us!

reviews.text: Friendly bar staff and efficient service in dining room which has a lovely vaulted, large, buzzy feel to it. Husbands steak cooked medium rare to perfection and delicious puds.
reviews.title: Definitely Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really reasonably priced for the standard and in the lovely little Montpellier area of Cheltenham - have all ready recommended o friends and we will definitely be returning!
reviews.title: Extremely stylish, friendly and comfortable
Service does not live up to the funky appearance
reviews.text: I stayed here with a group of friends and we absolutely loved the hotel. The food was beautiful and the service was fantastic. My room was very spacious,comfortable and stylish fitted with all the modern gadgets, along with a free minibar. Breakfast was great and again the staff were very helpful and friendly, this was a prefect way to end a perfect stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had no problem accommodating us for 1 night only, on a weekend, which is unusual when most places insist on 2 nights minimum stay. When we turned up early, the friendly and helpful staff were great. We were upgraded to a deluxe room from a standard, and it was spacious, well equipped and very stylish. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom, though compact, was excellent. It was very clean and we loved the rainshower over the bath. The hotel's location is central, easy walking distance from the shops bars & restaurants, yet we had a very quiet night. We also spent some time in the bar, which was buzzing, and the young team of staff were faultlessly efficient and friendly. As you might have gathered - we were very impressed and had a great stay.
reviews.title: Different from the Norm but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a modern hotel located close to the centre of Cheltenham. The rooms are large, modern and well furnished. Good quality bed, everyone should be able to get a good nights sleep. Modern bathrooms, but lacking a bit of light for shaving. Plenty of storage space.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, some points to be aware of

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly moderns reception area, check in is by lap top. Pleasant staff but without much authority to deal with problems.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent bar staff, 'London' quality knowledge of cocktails and spirits and friendly service. A destination bar.
reviews.title: Modern and fresh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is a la carte, good quality food, a little on the slow side, but no queues, even at weekend rush hour. Some skimping on the quantity. Order a round of toast and you get one slice, with a small dab of butter. Breakfast finishes at 10:30 on weekends, which is a bit mean, but they have other plans for the restaurant during the day
reviews.title: Fab rooms, great art and lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant, good quality cooking to a menu set by an Executive chef. Lacks character. Not a destination reataurant.
reviews.title: interesting property, great food and attentive staff

reviews.text: We just love this hotel. The service is amazing, all of the staff are incredibly friendly, professional and above all hard working. Superb bar snacks, afternoon tea and amazing cocktails. I cannot rate this place highly enough.
reviews.title: Brilliant dog friendly hotel with excellent friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location - close to the hip bars and restaurants and boutique shops of Montpellier. This hotel, and the room we stayed in (218), were probably one of the highest ranking of all of my experiences. The staff were first class too (love the suits and converse trainers as the uniform !
reviews.title: Superb boutique hotel

reviews.text: Some friends and I stayed at The Montpellier Chapter at the beginning of February and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
reviews.title: girls night away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were spotless, spacious and the beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Needs a management review

reviews.text: We enjoyed cocktails in the bar before having dinner in the restaurant which had a very relaxed yet vibrant ambience.
reviews.title: slipping standards

reviews.text: It makes you wonder if the people that run this place (I mean the real decision makers) actually read what people write here, because if they did surely this hotel would be the best in Cheltenham - if only they addressed the issues!
reviews.title: If only ...

reviews.text: Two of us stayed here recently for 1 night, we were able to find it okay and there was plenty of parking on site. The hotel is in the right end of town, with plenty of little shops to poke around in, and some nice bars and restaurants as well.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - but service a bit hit and miss

reviews.text: Whilst waiting for our room we had lunch, but wished we had gone somewhere else. The fire oven made the prospect of a pizza really inviting, but when it came I honestly thought that the chef had just re-heated one bought from Iceland (the shop, not the country!). It was thick and stodgy and just so wrong. We also ordered a cheese salad - but it came minus the cheese. We had 2 drinks - how can you charge £8 for a glass of Prosecco and keep a straight face?
reviews.title: 'Cool' hotel, friendly staff, a few issues

reviews.text: The waiters and waitresses on duty were gaggling away, whilst we were sat like plums waiting to be served, in the end we had to go and search one out.
reviews.title: Great value, great service, great offering
Slow, indifferent service
reviews.text: The room - we were in a feature room at the front of the hotel. I'm not sure what the feature was. The air con was noisy, the room was cold - even with the heating on. The room was modern and featureless - not really a nice place to be. The beds, however, were very comfortable.

Stayed at the montpellier chapter this month and couldnt of had a better evening. My friends and I enjoyed cocktails in the bar before our fabulous dinner in the restaurant. Great service, great wine and a room that I thoroughly enjoyed. My feature bath and rain forest shower topped off our perfect stay.
reviews.title: excellent getaway

reviews.text: Beautiful property and location. Very professional staff and lunchtime meals were good but expensive - try the Bramble Hedgerow Mocktail - worth the visit alone. Very pleasant Conservatory for taking a pre lunch drink. Now making the mocktail at home!
reviews.title: Business Lunch

reviews.text: Many good things about the hotel, but too many negatives happened over my 3 day stay.
reviews.title: Almost good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worst thing was that my hot shower went cold after 5 minutes at 705 AM. Unacceptable that any hotel should not have enough hot water for showers at peak time on a weekday. The apology I received when I mentioned it was that they would move me the next day if the problem repeated itself, which is basically saying we'll do nothing really unless you are inconvenienced a second time. One colleague mentioned he had the same issue that day.
reviews.title: Splendid

reviews.text: There was also an issue with my bathroom fan coming on and off every 10 to 20 seconds. A staff member came to my room and said they would have maintenance in the next day. The problem was manageable as long as the bathroom lights were out and the door was closed, but for some strange reason as soon as you opened the door or turned on the bathroom lights, it started again. The next day it seemed at first like it was fixed, as the bathroom door was open and the fan was silent when I got back in the evening, but the same thing started up again. I just slept with the bathroom door closed.
reviews.title: Stunning Hotel and Superb Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from a one night stay at The Montpellier Chapter and can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Flawless

reviews.text: Everything was on the money, from the smooth paperless check-in, the lovely room we were allocated (in the new part of the building - room 007), the amenities and facilities provided by the hotel, the smiling service to the brilliant evening meal in the restaurant. It was simply wonderful.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea
Wonderful Place to Stay
reviews.text: I arranged for my mum's 80th birthday, Afternoon tea for her and eight of her friends. It was fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and enjoyed by all. A huge thank you to the staff for making the occasion special.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, managed by children badly
Beautiful hotel
reviews.text: I stayed with 3 friends in April and although the hotel was full with a large wedding party, we all had a marvellous time. We were able to check in early to 2 fabulous rooms, these were linked with a small seating area which was an added bonus for us. We hadn't prebooked but the staff managed to sort out a reservation in the restaurant for our evening meal. The restaurant and bar had a great lively atmosphere and the food was wonderful. There seem to have been a few negative comments about the staff but that was not our experience at all. Everyone was very welcoming and friendly and dealt with any requests we had immediately, this was particularly impressive given that the hotel was full.

description: This brand-new, luxury hotel offers chic and stylish rooms featuring iPods and Nespresso coffee machines within Cheltenham’s fashionable Montpellier district.With artistic touches and contemporary design, all rooms at The Montpellier Chapter offer luxurious Egyptian cotton bed linen and complimentary minibars. Free Wi-Fi is available to all guests, while some rooms provide modern, open-plan bathrooms, computers, or an iPod Touch, which can connect directly to the TV.The Montpellier Chapter features a restaurant with open kitchen and open hearth oven. Guests can enjoy fine dining within, or venture into the garden room, terrace, or landscaped courtyard.Cheltenham town centre and Cheltenham Spa Rail Station are just 15 minutes’ walk from The Montpellier Chapter. Cheltenham’s famous racecourse is a 10-minute drive away, while Cheltenham’s spa history can be found at the 19th-century Pittville Pump Room and gardens, less than 10 minutes’ drive away.
